title: System dependencies register.
introduction: The dependencies register helps to control and manage third party dependencies.

adafruit_bno055.notes: Used for low-cost orientation sensor prototyping.

aenea.desc: Client-server library for using voice macros from Dragon NaturallySpeaking and Dragonfly on remote/non-windows hosts.

afl.desc: American fuzzy lop is a security-oriented fuzzer.

alembic.desc: Alembic is a database migrations tool.

altair.desc: Declarative statistical visualization library for Python.

arduino.notes: Used for prototyping simple hardware components.

astroid.desc: Enhanced AST for pylint and other projects.
astroid.notes: Required by PyLint, also used for other Python AST static analysis.

autobahn.desc: WebSocket and WAMP in Python for Twisted and asyncio.

avro.desc: Apache avro is a data serialization system.

avroknife.desc: Utility for browsing and simple manipulation of Avro-based files.

babel.notes: Required by sphinx. A manual build step is required to build data files

bandit.desc: A security linter from OpenStack Security.
bandit.notes: Used to find security issues in Python code.

baron.notes: Required by redbaron, used for python static analysis and refactoring.

bashplotlib.notes: Used to plot stuff in the terminal.

bazel.desc: Correct, reproducible, and fast builds for everyone.

beautiful_soup.desc: A tolerant HTML parser built for web scraping.

bidict.desc: Efficient, Pythonic bidirectional map implementation and related functionality.

blessings.desc: A thin, practical wrapper around terminal capabilities in Python

boltons.notes: A rather useful library used for a variety of different tasks.

boto.desc: Python interface to Amazon Web Services

bottle.desc: A fast and simple micro-framework for python web applications.
bottle.notes: Used to serve documentation, test results and reports.

bpython.desc: A fancy curses interface to the Python interactive interpreter.

brython.desc: An implementation of Python 3 running in the browser.

buck.desc: A fast build system that encourages the creation of small, reusable modules over a variety of platforms and languages.

bunch.desc: A Python dict providing attribute-style access.
bunch.notes: Used to make config object access more legible.

byteplay.desc: Face Python bytecode metaprogramming API fork.

caffe.desc: A fast open framework for deep learning.

cairosvg.desc: CairoSVG is a SVG converter based on Cairo.

capella.desc: Model based engineering using the Arcadia method.
capella.notes: Used for system level analysis and design.

capella_studio.desc: IDE for developing extensions for Capella MBSE.
capella_studio.notes: Used to develop extensions for the capella tool.

catkin.desc: A CMake-based build system that is used to build all packages in ROS.

clang.notes: Used to compile and lint C code.

click.notes: Used to parse command line args for da.

cloudpickle.desc: Extended pickling support for Python objects.
cloudpickle.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

cmake.desc: A cross platform open source build system generator.
cmake.notes: Required to build LAPACK for NumPy.

code2flow.desc: Turn your Python and Javascript code into DOT flowcharts.

colorama.notes: Required by radon. Used to display cyclomatic complexity measures.

cookiecutter.desc: A command-line utility that creates projects from templates.
cookiecutter.notes: Used to quickly create projects for counterparties.

cov_core.desc: A lib package for use by pytest-cov.

coverage.notes: Used to calculate test coverage metrics.

cppcheck.notes: Used to compile and lint C code.

crab.desc: A ﬂexible, fast recommender engine for Python.

curtsies.desc: Curses-like terminal wrapper with a display based on compositing 2d arrays of text.

cymem.desc: Manage calls to calloc/free through Cython.
cymem.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

cython.notes: Used to improve Python model runtime performance.

cytoolz.desc: Cython implementation of Toolz: High performance functional utilities.

d3_array.desc: Array manipulation, ordering, searching, summarizing, etc.

d3_brush.desc: Select a one- or two-dimensional region using the mouse or touch.

d3_drag.desc: Drag and drop SVG, HTML or Canvas using mouse or touch input.

d3_dsv.desc: A parser and formatter for delimiter-separated values, such as CSV and TSV.

d3_force.desc: Force-directed graph layout using velocity Verlet integration.

d3_hcg.desc: The hue-chroma-grayness color space derived from the Munsell color system.

d3_hexbin.desc: Group two-dimensional points into hexagonal bins.

d3_hierarchy.desc: Layout algorithms for visualizing hierarchical data in 2D.

d3_interpolate.desc: Interpolate numbers, colors, strings, arrays, objects, whatever!

d3_path.desc: Serialize Canvas path commands to SVG.

d3_sankey.desc: Visualize flow between nodes in a directed acyclic network.

d3_scale.desc: Encodings that map abstract data to visual representation.

d3_selection.desc: Transform the DOM by selecting elements and joining to data.

d3_tile.desc: Compute the quadtree tiles to display in a rectangular viewport.

d3_time.desc: A calculator for humanity’s peculiar conventions of time.

d3_timer.desc: An efficient queue for managing thousands of concurrent animations.

d3_zoom.desc: Pan and zoom SVG, HTML or Canvas using mouse or touch input.

d3js.desc: Bring data to life with SVG, Canvas and HTML.

das.desc: Demonstrates the power and simplicity of writing C++.programs in the data abstraction-style.

data_hacks.desc: Command line utilities for data analysis.

data_structure_zoo.desc: An educational repo for students looking to learn about data structures in Python.

deap.notes: Used by tpot for parameter tuning.

dexml.desc: A dead-simple object-xml mapper for Python.

ditaa.notes: Used to generate diagrams from source code comments.

ditaa_markdown.desc: Diagrams through ascii art in markdown documents.
ditaa_markdown.notes: Used to generate diagrams from markdown documents.

docopt.desc: Pythonic command line arguments parser, that will make you smile.

docutils.desc: Tools for processing plaintext documentation to HTML.

dragonfly.desc: Speech recognition framework allowing powerful Python-based scripting and extension of Dragon NaturallySpeaking (DNS) and Windows Speech Recognition (WSR).

dragonfly_scripts.desc: A collection of python scripts that can be used with Dragonfly.

eliot.desc: A causality-based logging library for Python.

errbot.desc: Errbot is a chatbot, a daemon that connects to your favorite chat service and bring your tools and some fun into the conversation.

ethzasl_msf.desc: Modular framework for multi sensor fusion based on an Extended Kalman Filter (EKF).

extras.desc: Extra code that should be part of the standard library but isn't.

fabric.desc: Simple, Pythonic remote execution and deployment.

fabricate.desc: The better build tool. Finds dependencies automatically for any language.

fastavro.desc: A fast python library to support the apache avro serialization protocol.

figleaf.desc: A code coverage recording and analysis package for Python.
figleaf.notes: Used to calculate test coverage metrics.

fixtures.desc: Python fixtures for testing / resource management.

flexx.desc: Write desktop and web apps in pure Python.

flintplusplus.desc: A Cross Platform Port of Facebook's C++ Linter.

fn_py.desc: Functional programming in Python: implementation of missing features to enjoy FP.

funcparserlib.desc: Recurisve descent parsing library for python based on functional combinators.
funcparserlib.notes: Used by blockdiag for generating architecture diagrams.

funcy.desc: A fancy and practical functional tools.

fuzzywuzzy.desc: A python module to perform fuzzy string matching.
fuzzywuzzy.notes: Used by the QMS to find build configuration files given partially matching query strings.

genshi.desc: Python toolkit for generation of output for the web.

git_gutter.desc: A Sublime Text 2/3 plugin to see git diff in gutter.

gitdb.desc: Python module to perform IO on git-style object databases.

gitkraken.desc: Git GUI Client for Windows Mac and Linux.
gitkraken.notes: Used when we do stuff to git manually.

gitpython.desc: Python module to interact with Git repositories.
gitpython.notes: Used to interface with source document repositories.

gst_python.notes: Experiment in using GStreamer based dataflow networks.

gunicorn.desc: Green Unicorn is a WSGI HTTP Server for UNIX, fast clients and sleepy applications.

h5py.desc: A Pythonic interface to the HDF5 binary data format.
h5py.notes: Used to read segmentations done by ilastik.

html5lib_python.desc: HTML parser based on the WHATWG HTML specification.
html5lib_python.notes: Used as part of the engineering document compilation pipeline.

hyperopt.desc: Distributed Asynchronous Hyperparameter Optimization in Python.

hypothesis.desc: Hypothesis is an advanced Quickcheck style testing library for Python.
hypothesis.notes: Used to generate test cases based on assertions.

jdcal.desc: A library to handle Julian dates stored as two numbers.
jdcal.notes: Required by openpyxl for generating Excel format reports.

jedi.desc: Awesome autocompletion and static analysis library for python.

jinja2.desc: Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python.

kivy.desc: Cross platform python framework for NUI development.
kivy.notes: Used for algorithm visualisation and label tool.

lazy_object_proxy.desc: A fast and thorough lazy object proxy.
lazy_object_proxy.notes: Required by astroid and PyLint. Used for static analysis using the Python AST.

libxml2.desc: The XML C parser and toolkit of Gnome
libxml2.notes: Required by lxml. Used to generate reports and documentation.

lxml.desc: The lxml XML toolkit for Python.
lxml.notes: Used to generate reports and documentation. Needs libxml2

lz4.desc: LZ4 is a lossless compression algorithm.

mando.desc: Create Python CLI apps with little to no effort at all.
mando.notes: Required by radon. Used to measure cyclomatic complexity.

markupsafe.desc: Implements a unicode subclass that supports HTML strings.

metaopt.desc: MetaOpt optimizes black-box functions in parallel.

murmurhash.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

mypy.desc: An optional static type checker for Python.

networkx.desc: A Python package for studying complex networks.

numpy.notes: Required by many of our scientific computing dependencies.

openpyxl.desc: A Python library to read and write Excel 2007 files.

pants.desc: Pants is a build system for software projects in a variety of languages.

papyrus_rt.desc: Model based engineering and code generation.
papyrus_rt.notes: Used to investigate model driven development techniques.

pathlib.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

pep257.desc: A static analysis tool for checking docstring style.
pep257.notes: Used for style-checking Python language source documents.

pep8.notes: Used for style-checking Python language source documents.

pfff.desc: Tools for code analysis, visualizations, or style-preserving source transformation.

pillow.notes: Used for image processing in Python.

pip.desc: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
pip.notes: Required by metaopt setup script to parse requirements files.

plac.desc: The smartest command line arguments parser in the world.
plac.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

pluggy.desc: Plugin management and hook calling for Python.

powerline.notes: Used to make tmux look pretty.

powerline_fonts.notes: Used by powerline to make tmux look pretty.

preshed.desc: Cython hash table for pre-hashed keys.
preshed.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

protobuf.desc: Protocol Buffers - Google's data interchange format.

pudb.desc: A console-based visual debugger for Python.

py.desc: The py lib is a Python development support library.
py.notes: Used by py.test to support unit testing.

py_gfm.notes: Used to generate reports and documentation.

py_good.notes: Used to verify design data and metadata against defined schema.

pybind11.notes: Could be used for running compiled C/C++ code under MIL/SIL.

pycallgraph.desc: Create call graphs for Python programs.
pycallgraph.notes: Used to generate call graphs to help navigate and visualise program structure.

pycharm.desc: A full-featured IDE for Python and web development.
pycharm.notes: Investigated as a possible alternative to Sublime Text.

pyclassifiers.desc: A sporadically-updated collection of statistical classifiers in pure Python.

pycodestyle.notes: Formerly called pep8. Used for static analysis of design documents written in Python.

pydocstyle.notes: Formerly called pep256. Used for static analysis of design documents written in Python.

pyflakes.desc: A simple program which checks Python source files for errors.

pygments.desc: Pygments is a syntax highlighting package written in Python.
pygments.notes: Required by pudb. Used for debugging.

pygtk.desc: Python bindings for Atk, Pango, Gtk and libglade.

pylint.desc: A Python static analysis and testing tool.
pylint.notes: Used for static analysis and testing of design documents written in the Python language.

pymongo.notes: Used by hyperopt for inter process communication.

pymutester.desc: A tool to facilitate mutation testing in Python.
pymutester.notes: Used to check sufficiency of test coverage.

pyrobuf.desc: A Cython alternative to Google's Python Protobuf library.

pyrun2.notes: Used to ensure consistent behaviour in the build.

pyrun3.notes: Used to ensure consistent behaviour in the build.

pyservice.desc: A simple library to make services on python more easily.
pyservice.notes: Intended to be used for build progress monitoring daemons.

pystache.notes: Required by pycco. Used to generate HTML documentation.

pytest.desc: A powerful and elegant python test framework.
pytest.notes: Intended to be used to run unit tests.

pytest_bdd.desc: BDD library for the py.test runner.
pytest_bdd.notes: Intended to be used to run BDD style unit tests.

pytest_cagoule.desc: Run the subset of tests that touch the code you've just changed.

pytest_cov.notes: Intended to be used to check test coverage levels.

pytest_incremental.desc: Py-test plugin: an incremental test runner.

pytest_json.desc: Generate json reports from pytest runs.
pytest_json.notes: Intended to be used to help report test results.

pytest_testmon.desc: Taking TDD to a new level with testmon and py.test for Python

python_afl.desc: A Python interface to AFL, allowing for easy injection of testcases and other functionality.

python_docx.desc: Create and modify Word documents with Python.
python_docx.notes: Used to generate reports and documentation.

python_docx_template.desc: Use a docx as a jinja2 template.
python_docx_template.notes: Used to generate reports and documentation.

python_markdown.notes: Used to generate reports and documentation.

python_mimeparse.desc: Basic functions for handling mime-types in python.

python_prompt_toolkit.desc: Library for building powerful interactive command lines in Python.

python_snappy.desc: Python bindings for the snappy google library.

pytrie.desc: An efficient implementation of a prefix tree (trie) using Python dictionaries, with autocompletion.

pytz.desc: Python historical timezone library and database.

pyzen.desc: A continuous test runner for Python.

radon.desc: Various code metrics for Python code.
radon.notes: Intended to be used to measure cyclomatic complexity and other metrics.

redbaron.desc: Abstraction on top of baron, a FST for python to make writing refactoring code a realistic task.
redbaron.notes: Used for python refactoring and code generation.

requests.desc: A Python package for studying complex networks.

robotframework.notes: Used for Acceptance Test Driven Development.

ruamel_yaml.desc: A YAML parser and emitter that supports roundtrip conversion.
ruamel_yaml.notes: Used to obtain line numbers for tracing the origin of embedded YAML metadata.

scipy.desc: Open-source software for mathematics, science, and engineering.

semver.desc: A python module for semantic versioning.
semver.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

sentry.desc: Sentry is a realtime event logging and aggregation platform.

setuptools.desc: Extensions to the distutils for large or complex distributions.
setuptools.notes: Many of our python library dependencies require setuptools to build.

shove.desc: Common object storage frontend that supports dictionary-style access, object serialization and compression, and multiple storage and caching backends.

side_bar_enhancements.desc: Enhancements to Sublime Text sidebar. Files and folders.

simpy.notes: A framework for MIL and SIL simulations.

six.desc: Six is a Python 2 and 3 compatibility library.
six.notes: Required by PyLint. Used to run static testing.

smmap.notes: Required by gitpython. Used to interface with source document repositories.

snowballstemmer.desc: Snowball stemming library collection for Python.

sofi.desc: An OS agnostic UI module for Python.

sortedcontainers.desc: Python Sorted Container Types: SortedList, SortedDict, and SortedSet.

spacy.notes: Used to improve the quality of requirements.

sphinx.notes: Required to build documentation for many dependencies.

sphinxcontrib_multilatex.desc: A Sphinx extension that allows LaTeX/PDF documents to be declared and parameterized within reStructuredText source files.
sphinxcontrib_multilatex.notes: Used to build engineering documents with Sphinx.

sphinxcontrib_traceables.desc: A Sphinx extension offering traceability within documentation.
sphinxcontrib_traceables.notes: Used to build engineering documents with Sphinx.

splint.notes: Used to lint C program files.

sputnik.desc: Extended pickling support for Python objects.
sputnik.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

sqlalchemy.desc: The Python SQL Toolkit and Object Relational Mapper.

sqlitedict.desc: A persistent dict, backed-up by SQLite and pickle.

sr_build_tools:.desc: Contains build tools and rosinstall files for Shadow Robot's Software.

sr_common:.desc: The bare minimum for communicating with the Shadow Hand.

sr_ros_control_robot:.desc: Implementation of a generic multi-robot ros_control loop.

sr_vision:.desc: Vision related algorithms including segmentation, tracking and recognition.

statsmodels.desc: Statistical modeling and econometrics in Python.

stuf.desc: A collection of Python dictionary types that support attribute-style access.
stuf.notes: Required by shove. Used to help understand persistence.

styleguide.desc: Style guides for Google-originated open-source projects.

subl.desc: Sublime Text - A text editor that can be automated using Python.
subl.notes: Used for general purpose text editing.

subunit.desc: The subunit test reporting and controlling protocol.

superdict.desc: SuperDict - it's like dict, but better.

tablib.desc: Python Module for Tabular Datasets in XLS, CSV, JSON, YAML, &c.

tblib.desc: Traceback fiddling library. Allows you to pickle tracebacks.
tblib.notes: Used so we can throw exceptions across process boundaries.

tdigest.desc: T-digest data structure. Useful for percentiles and quantiles.

tensorflow.desc: Computation using data flow graphs for scalable machine learning.

testscenarios.desc: Testscenarios, a pyunit extension for dependency injection.

theano.desc: A Python library that allows you to work with multi-dimensional arrays efficiently.

thinc.desc: Learn super-sparse multi-class models in Cython.
thinc.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

tinycss.desc: Tinycss is a complete yet simple CSS parser for Python.

toga.desc: A Python native, OS native GUI toolkit.

toolz.desc: A functional standard library for Python.

tornado.desc: Tornado is a Python web framework and asynchronous networking library, originally developed at FriendFeed.

tpot.desc: TPOT is a Python tool that automatically creates and optimizes machine learning pipelines using genetic programming.
tpot.notes: Used for parameter tuning classification algorithms.

tqdm.desc: A fast, extensible progress bar for Python

trac.desc: Trac is an enhanced wiki and issue tracking system for software development projects.

transcrypt.notes: Used to develop client-side code in Python.

treelib.desc: An efficient implementation of tree data structure in python 2/3.

tup.desc: Tup is a file-based build system.

twine.desc: Twine is a command line tool for managing your strings and their translations.

twisted.desc: Event-driven networking engine written in Python.

txaio.desc: Utilities to support code that runs unmodified on Twisted and asyncio.

ultrajson.desc: Ultra fast JSON encoder and decoder for Python.
ultrajson.notes: Required by SpaCy natural language processing lib.

update_checker.desc: A python module that will check for package updates.
update_checker.notes: Used by tpot for parameter tuning classification algorithms.

urwid.desc: Console user interface library for Python.
urwid.notes: Required by pudb. Used for debugging.

vagrant.desc: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

vega_lite.desc: A high-level grammar for visual analysis, built on top of Vega.

virtualbox.desc: An x86 and AMD64/Intel64 virtualization product.
virtualbox.notes: Used for build system virtualization. Warning: Always runs system VBox -- not portable.

vispy.desc: A high-performance interactive 2D/3D data visualization library.

voluptuous.notes: Used to verify design data and metadata against defined schema.

wcwidth.desc: Measures number of Terminal column cells of wide-character codes.

wdb.desc: An improbable web debugger through WebSockets.

weasyprint.desc: WeasyPrint converts HTML documents to PDF.

windows.notes: Used to run nuance voice recognition software.

wrapt.desc: A Python module for decorators, wrappers and monkey patching.
wrapt.notes: Used by astroid, which is used by PyLint.

xenon.notes: Intended for use in checking complexity metrics.

xerox.desc: Simple Copy and Paste in Python.

xgboost.notes: Used by tpot for parameter tuning classification algorithms.

xlwings.notes: Only windows and OSX are supported at the moment.

yaml.desc: The next generation YAML parser and emitter for Python.
yaml.notes: Used to read and write YAML format configuration files. Currently built without support for libyaml

zope_interface.desc: Design by contract interfaces for Python.
